snippet: The four-year measure will speed the modernization of the air traffic control system toward the era of satellite navigation.
abstract: Senate passes a four-year, $63 billion compromise bill to renew and extend federal aviation programs through 2015; measure will speed the modernization of the air traffic control system toward the era of satellite navigation and stabilize the Federal Aviation Administration, whose authorization expired in 2007.
lead_paragraph: The four-year measure will speed the modernization of the air traffic control system toward the era of satellite navigation.

headline.seo: F.A.A. Funding Bill Passes, Speeding Shift to G.P.S. Navigation
headline.main: Bill Financing F.A.A. Passes, Ending Years of Stopgap Steps
headline.print_headline: Bill Financing F.A.A. Passes, Ending Years of Stopgap Steps
